Key Match Events: Abdullah Shafique and Fakhar Zaman gave Pakistan an opening partnership of 100 runs
Fakhar Zaman marked his return to the side with a belligerent knock of 81 runs
Pakistan’s pace bowlers took eight wickets dismissing Bangladesh for 204 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan have kept alive their slim hopes of qualifying for the semifinals of the ICC Cricket World Cup
Bangladesh’s sixth defeat has ended Shakib al-Hasan’s team’s hopes of qualifying for the semifinals
Pakistan have now won three matches from their seven and still have a mathematical chance of qualifying
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan’s three-pronged pace attack impressed with the new ball and were equally effective in the death overs
Only Mahmudullah (56) managed a half-century for Bangladesh
